page.title: 01INTRODUCING WEST KILBRIDE
page.content:
{West Kilbride is a small village on {the Firth of Clyde.}It stands about one kilometre from the shore which is a lovely sandy beach and stretches for three to four kilometres along the coast. The{Isle of Arran lies like a "sleeping warrior" about twentyfive kilometres across the firth. The{village population is 4500.
{The village lies amids dairy {farmland, bordered by high hills and {moorland.}It has two castles, although one is really in Portencross. The other,Law Castle,will soon be restored and inhabited. There is a large main street with all the shops you would need, including _ two chemists,a cafe, a restaurant and health-food shop. We also have three churches, two public halls, a railway station and several public houses.
